entry.title: [Files app]: set ProviderID on Fusebox FSP volumes
entry.content:
This makes the isOneDrive TypeScript function (in entry_utils.ts) pick

up both the Fusebox and non-Fusebox flavors of the OneDrive volumes.

Prior to this commit, only the non-Fusebox flavor matched.



After this commit, the Fusebox+ODFS volume is now sorted in the same

sidenav panel slot as the Non-Fusebox+ODFS volume. It is also a

pre-requisite for fixing b/328698363.

entry.content:
Move the subframe group to be the first group in

testing/variations/fieldtrial_testing_config.json so that it will be

the settings enabled on bots. Also updates layout test expectation

to account for the extra renderer DidStartNavigation we get on the

entry.title: [Files]: Adding operation results to file index methods.
entry.content:
In preparation for SQL implementation we need to support a failure of

any of the indexing operations. This CL adds OpResults which can be used

to communicate the outcome of an operation. In addition, it modifies the

logic of the UpdateFile() method to disallow updates with empty terms.

entry.title: [Office upload] Handle when the upload flow fails from a non-Office file
entry.content:
If a non-Office file is renamed to have an Office file extension, the

user can initiate the upload flow to try to move it and open it with

Google Docs. Although the move to Google Drive is successful, it cannot

be opened with Google Docs. This case is detected when:

- The alternate URL host is "drive.google.com".

- The mime type is not an Office mime type.



Show a new error message "File is not a valid document" in this case.

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AzhUBwFospBdw58.png



Introduce new enum OfficeFilesUploadResult::kFileNotAnOfficeFile to

record this metric.



Introduce new helper functions:

- IsOfficeFileMimeType()

- GetNotAValidDocumentErrorMessage()



Bug: b/322909593 b/323452926

Change-Id: Ic1395ff6c86bd3c92c39c9cf734f47fc9bf0438d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5347997

Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

Reviewed-by: Peter Marshall

Reviewed-by: Nigel Tao

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271992}

entry.content:

entry.title: pine: If there is pine restore data, overview shows pine dialog
entry.content:
In `StartOverview` we change the enter overview type if

`pine_contents_data` is not null. `pine_contents_data` will get deleted

if the restore or cancel buttons are clicked or if an app window is

launched.



This also fixes an issue with overview type kImmediateEnter not being

compatible with a pine overview session. Now overview shows the dialog

if pine_contents_data_ is available. We also port closing the

notification when a new window is launched for the dialog. This will

make sure pine_contents_data_ is deleted when that happens so we

don't show the pine dialog after that.



Bug: b/326441709

Bug: b/328833270

Test: manual

Test: ash_unittests Pine*

Test: browser_tests PineBrowserTest.ReenterOverviewPineSession

Change-Id: I349d2550ed37f416fdbbe052c7182785b3083bb1

entry.title: Eche: Improve handling of feature state received from Phone Hub.
entry.content:
This fixes a bug that occurred when setting the Eche feature state to

available through Phone Hub's PhoneStatus proto which caused the UI to

always show gray app circles with no way to finish onboarding.



The logic inside EcheFeatureStatusProvider duplicated much of what is

already handled by the MultideviceSetup component, this change avoids

this and respects the feature status that is provided.



To avoid rolling out the above mentioned bug to users this also sets a

bit in the CrosState proto to inform the phone that it's safe to send

the status without breaking the feature.



Bug: b/325670318, b/246842111

Change-Id: I52b78f1992fe401ac5cce2b3c640ef6324cef99e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5362721

entry.title: mahi: Clear focused page info when change focused.
entry.content:
If a page takes a while to load, the focused state still keeps the info

of the previous page. So if user requests in the meanwhile, it can show

the info wrongly. This CL forces to clear the state if the focused page

has changed but has not finish loading yet.



Also change the logic of focused page check so that it works fine for

restoring previously opened pages.

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: Fix intra/vp80-01-intra-141(6|7).ivf cases
entry.content:
vp80-01-intra-141(6|7).ivf are spec test sequences composed of one

single I frame. This translates into one Decode() call with the

encoded chunk, and a Decode() call with an EOS DecoderBuffer.



Depending on the speed of such calls, it might be that the CAPTURE

queue hasn't had time to be configured by the time the EOS is

received, and ToT code does not schedule a poll() to listen for events (via RearmCAPTUREQueueMonitoring()). Instead, it only listens for and

sees the CAPTURE queue "resolution change" event, not listening for

anything else (because no other Decode() calls are received).



The solution is to simply make sure RearmCAPTUREQueueMonitoring() is

called at the end of the CAPTURE queue configuration.



Tested on trogdor and hana.



Bug: b:329051390

Change-Id: I4fc451e86fda12704610304087d6a8657d4893aa

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5367530

entry.title: Update test runner to account for same-site RFH change
entry.content:
With RenderDocument, we can change RenderFrames within the same

process. This is not currently handled correctly by some parts of the

WebTestControlHost. This is fixed by this CL by:

- Making WebTestWindowObserver observe pre-existing speculative RFHs

(it would miss them otherwise since those already called

RenderFrameCreated before the construction of WebTestWindowObserver)

- Making WebTestControlHost call ReplicateWebTestRuntimeFlagsChanges

on all WebTestRenderFrameRemotes instead of only one per renderer

process (as there can be multiple)



Bug: 936696

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Move v4l2_unittest.cc out of test/ folder
entry.content:
In Chromium it's customary to have the ...unitest.cc files next or very

close to the classes they test; IOW the test/ folder is not for all unit

tests but for the very specific platform decoder binary. This CL thus

moves the unittest.cc file out of the test/ folder.



Executed via `git mv` and `tools/git/mass-rename.py`.

entry.title: [AriaNotify] Support multiple AriaNotification string attributes
entry.content:

notification id in favor of a `StringListAttribute` for both, which

will allow multiple notifications to be serialized into `AXNodeData`.



2. Refactoring `TruncateAndAddStringAttribute` to reuse its logic for

`StringListAttribute` in a new helper `TruncateString`.

entry.title: [Gardener] Revert "Add indicator when notifications permission is blocked by the OS."
entry.content:
This reverts commit e77dbc56f726c5929bf14cb17c0dcb6bafbf2007.



Reason for revert: Seems to cause WebAppIntegration test failures on

multiple Mac builders, e.g.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests



Sample failure (mentions AppShimRegistry and LocationBarView):

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/17853/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Add indicator when notifications permission is blocked by the OS.

>

> When notifications aren't working for a PWA because permission

> was blocked at the OS level (but granted at the chrome level), this

> CL causes an indicator icon to be shown (in omnibox or titlebar

> depending on if the PWA is open in a browser tab or PWA window).

> This icon has a bubble guiding the user to System Settings to fix

> this situation. Additionally this bubble automatically pops up when

> chrome auto-denies notification permission because the system level

> permission was previously denied.

>

> Currently only notification usage in documents causes this icon/bubble

> to show. If all notification usage is done in worker contexts the

> icon will not be shown (as there might not even be any document to

> show the icon in in that case).

>

> Bug: 40616749

entry.title: exo: Make sure OcclusionObserver is called when ShellSurface is ready
entry.content:
In some situations (e.g. restore of minimized windows), occlusion will

not be updated after the initial configure when ShellSurface::IsReady is

true. For example, for minimized windows, it will be hidden forever and

not change. This wasn't a problem before, because we would send the

initial configure with an occlusion state of hidden in this case.

However, we introduced a workaround in OcclusionObserver::

GetInitialStateForConfigure which means the occlusion state did not

match.



So, in this CL we make sure to call OcclusionObserver::MaybeConfigure

when IsReady becomes true. Even without the workaround in

GetInitialStateForConfigure, it's conceptually better to do this, to

cover both state change edges (IsReady, and occlusion state).



Bug: 1278648

Test: CQ

Change-Id: I9894b19229b7cb0b60495e71af3ba203891fde73

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5360773

entry.title: [Demo Mode] Add two demo mode switch cases to ChangeAppLocale()
entry.content:
Rename APP_LOCALE_CHANGED_VIA_DEMO_SESSION to

APP_LOCALE_CHANGED_VIA_DEMO_SESSION_REVERT because

APP_LOCALE_CHANGED_VIA_SYSTEM_TRAY could also come from the demo

mode.



In profile_impl.cc:ChangeAppLocale(), we add no-op to the switch case

APP_LOCALE_CHANGED_VIA_DEMO_SESSION and

APP_LOCALE_CHANGED_VIA_SYSTEM_TRAY. In this case, we keep their

behavior as before to avoid introducing potential errors.



We also removed the default case so the compiler can flag it when we

add a new enum value but forget to add its switch case in

chrome/browser/profiles/profile_impl.cc the next time. This should

prevent such future issues.

entry.title: [Files]: Fix the handling of the field and text separator.
entry.content:
In the previous implementation if there was a trailing colon in the

field, or leading colon in the text, they would result in the identical

term. Thus one could insert term "bar" with the field "foo:", or insert

term ":bar" with the field "foo" and get the same result. This CL fixes

this issue by using field name as a "name space" for term and posting

lists. This way the field "foo:" generates posting and term lists in one

namespace, while the field "foo" generates them in a different

namespace, never leading to collisions.



Bug: b:327535200

entry.title: [URL] Update Origin and SecurityOrigin to consider non-special URLs
entry.content:
Update url::Origin and blink::SecurityOrigin to consider the correct

support of non-special scheme URLs (http://crbug.com/40063064), by which

host and port information are now available even for non-special URLs.



Background:



The Web Standard requires non-special URLs to have an opaque origin.

Chromium generally follows this standard. Thus, regarding Origin, the

correct support of non-special URLs should have minimal impact on web

compatibility because host and port parts are unimportant to opaque

origins.



However, due to historical reasons, Chromium has implemented several

workarounds for non-special scheme URLs, such as `url::SchemeRegistry`

and AndroidWebViewHack.



Example:



url::SchemeRegistry allows non-special URLs to be treated as if they

have non-opaque origins, as if they were standard URLs in parsing them,

and so on.



Suppose that we register "local-but-nonstandard:" scheme as a Local

scheme using `url::AddLocalScheme("local-but-nonstandard")`.



Then, the origin of "local-but-nonstandard://examplecom:80" URL becomes

non-opaque.



However, given that "local-but-nonstandard:" scheme is not registered as

a standard scheme, the origin's internal `SchemeHostPort` tuple will be:



("local-but-nonstandard", "", 0)



instead of



("local-but-nonstandard", "example.com", 80)



because of incomplete parsing of non-special URLs so far, where host and

port information are not captured.



Changes:



Now, we have a correct non-special URL scheme parsing. The origin's

internal SchemeHostPort tuple can be



("local-but-nonstandard", "example.com", 80)



because the new parser parses non-special URLs correctly.



This CL updates url::Origin so that it considers non-special URLs

correctly, aligning with the correct non-special URL support.



Impacts:



While the overall web compatibility impact is expected to be minimal,

there might be some unintended consequences in Chromium specific

scenarios, such as:



- "local-but-nonstandard:" scheme behavior: Code relying on this

scheme's previous non-opaque behavior might be affected due to changes

in origin handling.



- AndroidWebViewHack: Potential compatibility issues with the Android

WebView component, which is extremely high.



Ideally, we should update the current behavior everywhere so that we can

consider host and port parts, instead of ignoring them, however, this

would bring an extremely high risk of breakage for Android WebView.

There is basically no way to change how Android WebView behaves.



Therefore, this CL updates the behaviors of "local-but-nonstandard"

cases, but preserves the current Android WebView behavior by discarding

host and port information intentionally. This might be a bad outcome.



This is not a final decision. I'll re-evaluate once I have more

information.





The summary of what's changed and what's not changed:



For the two URLs, A) "non-standard://a.com:80" and B)

"non-standard://b.com:80", and with AndroidWebViewHack enabled:



```

| | Same origin? | Serialization of A's origin |

|------------------+--------------+-----------------------------|

| Current behavior | true | "non-standard://" |

| After this CL | true | "non-standard://" |

```





For the two URLs, A) "local-but-nonstandard://a.com:80" and B)

"local-but-nonstandard://b.com:80":



```

| | Same origin? | Serialization of A's origin |

|------------------+--------------+------------------------------------|

| Current behavior | true | "local-but-nonstandard://" |

| After this CL | false | "local-but-nonstandard://a.com:80" |

```



See url/origin_unittest.cc and url/origin_abstract_tests.h in this CL

for details.



For historical context on nonstandard scheme URLs and Andvoid WebView

behavior, see the followings:



- https://crrev.com/c/1208811

- https://crrev.com/c/1338660



WPT url Tests:



There should be no impacts on WPT url tests.



Next steps:



Following CLs will address potential issues in tests and code currently

relying on the old workarounds. These subsequent changes will help us

assess the overall impact and ensure a smooth transition to the new

behavior.



Bug: 40063064

Change-Id: I53ac86503041b869a002a1ea02b18e0002b4b11d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5309015

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

entry.title: [remoting] Create VideoCapturers with an initial screen ID.
entry.content:
This CL adds a screen ID parameter to

DesktopEnvironment::CreateVideoCapturer() so that capturers are always

created with an initial ID. For single-stream mode, the ID is

explicitly set to kFullDesktopScreenId.



With multi-stream, each capturer is created for a specific display and

it stays constant for the capturer's lifetime. The upcoming Mojo

refactoring will create a separate Mojo channel for each capturer,

indexed by screen ID.



Before this CL, the multi-stream implementation created each capturer

and then called SelectSource() on the capturer. This complicates the

Mojo refactor, because it has to wait for a SelectSource() call

before it can create the Mojo channel for the capturer. If the ID is

known in advance by DesktopSessionProxy, it can create the Mojo

channel and store the capturer's entry in the map at creation-time.



When all platforms are switched to multi-stream, the

DesktopCapturer::SelectSource() interface method will no longer be

needed.



Bug: 326319067

Change-Id: If6e287407fdd17a372f628f418b5c3e34dcd9806

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5367338

entry.title: Revert "media/gpu/ip_factory: Update GL Scaling for VDA tests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9d2c91e927711cdb05ba09af237a45db5700512f.



Reason for revert: broke tree: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-lacros-dbg/32159/overview



Original change's description:

> media/gpu/ip_factory: Update GL Scaling for VDA tests

>

> In crrev/c/5327871, the |kUseGLForScaling| flag was set to be enabled

> by default. This resulted in the video_decode_accelerator_tests being

> broken due to ozone and threading errors.

>

> The test was updated to initialize Ozone and GLSurfaceTestSupport.

> To handle threading, |ScopedAllowBaseSyncPrimitives| was added to

> the gl backend and thread restrictions was updated respectively to make

> the gl backend a friend class.

>

entry.title: Generate connect job params first, then create ConnectJob
entry.content:
This factors creation of ConnectJob params out into a "pure", easily

tested function. This presages a refactoring of that function to support

more combinations of proxy chains and endpoints.



That new, easily-tested function comes with a test suite running some

480 new tests comprehensively covering the supported combinations of

inputs to the function. This test suite is easily extended as support

for new chains is added.



This leaves the tests for `ConnectJobFactory` intact, to ensure that the

corner cases they cover (such as `..WithoutSchema`) aren't missed.

entry.title: Add indicator when notifications permission is blocked by the OS.
entry.content:
When notifications aren't working for a PWA because permission

was blocked at the OS level (but granted at the chrome level), this

CL causes an indicator icon to be shown (in omnibox or titlebar

depending on if the PWA is open in a browser tab or PWA window).

This icon has a bubble guiding the user to System Settings to fix

this situation. Additionally this bubble automatically pops up when

chrome auto-denies notification permission because the system level

permission was previously denied.



Currently only notification usage in documents causes this icon/bubble

to show. If all notification usage is done in worker contexts the

icon will not be shown (as there might not even be any document to

show the icon in in that case).

entry.title: [Files]: Fix a potentially flaky test.
entry.content:
On Mar 12 the searchDocumentsProviderWithRecencyOptions test failed a

number of times

(https://cr-buildbucket.appspot.com/build/8753693854047623249). The

cause was a mismatch between expected absolute date and returned

relative date:



["hello-recent-5.txt","51 bytes","Plain text","Mar 9, 2024, 11:44 PM"]

["hello-recent-5.txt","51 bytes","Plain text","Yesterday 11:44 PM"]



Here we fix this issue by making sure all files are at least 4 days old.

This should take care of phrases such as today, yesterday, two days ago

(present in some languages), etc.

entry.title: [Extensions] Introduce a CoreExtensionsRendererAPIProvider
entry.content:
The ExtensionsRendererAPIProvider was introduced as a way for layers

outside of //extensions to add API-specific bits to the extensions

system. It was originally introduced for the controlled frame work, but

with the intention that we could use it in other places to more fully

align with the pattern used in the other (browser and common) layers.



This CL introduces a new CoreExtensionsRendererAPIProvider and

moves the source map registrations that were previously handled in

the //extensions layer's implementation of the Dispatcher into the

new provider instead. This isolates the API implementation and logic

from the core extensions system (the Dispatcher).



This also required changing how the ShellExtensionsRendererClient

creates the Dispatcher, since it now also needs to provide the

CoreExtensionsRendererAPIProvider. This is done in a way to most

closely mirror the //chrome implementation (handling it in

RenderThreadCreated).



Followups will continue moving bits into the new API provider.



This CL should have no behavior change.



Bug: 326903574

entry.title: arc: Relax the conservative check to block ARC on pre ARC-N filesystem
entry.content:
The "pref not set" state should never happen, but just for being

conservative, the unexpected state assumed the filesystem to be

incompatible, and blocked to boot ARC.



It was indeed a safe choice at M60, when we launched ARC-N on

Elm/Hana (the only live boards that predates ARC-N as of today.)

Today at M124, however, basically all the users have already

migrated there filesystem. The safer choice is to assume the

filesystem is compatible, so that we don't accidentally disable ARC

even under bugs like b/327969092.



Note that the new code is still safe as long as everything is

working fine. The pref is always set as incompatbile for users

with truly incompatible filessytem, and ARC is blocked. Even with

the first known bug b/327969092 for this scenario, since it affects

only the initial sign-in (i.e., the new filesystem by default),

the new code is still safe.



BUG=b:327969092, b:329168451

TEST=Repeat autologin.py --arc



Change-Id: I4aa9a47c7a8af483da1c36618684a506482d093d

entry.title: Use HostResolver::Host for HostRsolverManager::JobKey
entry.content:
Before this CL, HostResolverManager::JobKey didn't include port for

scheme-less requests to dedupe Jobs. However, this behavior becomes

problematic when we want to create intermediate endpoints from partial

DNS responses in the middle of a job, as the job needs to know the

requested port to create appropriate IPEndPoints. This CL uses

variant to pass the requested port to

avoid the problem.



This change could duplicate Jobs when two requests came in at the same

time for the same domain but different ports. However, this is a

corner case and the duplication wouldn't matter much.



Bug: 1206799,41493696

entry.title: Ensure SearchActivity uses a single SearchBoxDataProvider instance.
entry.content:
During its lifetime, SearchActivity will receive

- one (initial) and

- zero or more new intents.



Current architecture encourages instantiation of new

SearchBoxDataProvider for each new intent that the search activity

receives, which will quickly create a disconnection between what

SearchActivity set up vs what all other components use.



While technically the nature of this change is secondary, it enables

us to alter SearchBoxDataProvider values to make them readily

available to LocationBar and Autocomplete.

entry.title: media/gpu/ip_factory: Update GL Scaling for VDA tests
entry.content:
In crrev/c/5327871, the |kUseGLForScaling| flag was set to be enabled

by default. This resulted in the video_decode_accelerator_tests being

broken due to ozone and threading errors.



The test was updated to initialize Ozone and GLSurfaceTestSupport.

To handle threading, |ScopedAllowBaseSyncPrimitives| was added to

the gl backend and thread restrictions was updated respectively to make

the gl backend a friend class.



Finally, the image_processor_factory is updated to make sure that the

|useGLForScaling| flag only creates a valid GLBackend when the operation

is NV12 scaling.

entry.title: [Optimization Guide Internals] Add filtering.
entry.content:
This CL adds to chrome://optimization-guide-internals/ data table

filtering by applying optional "include" and "exclude" text matches to

each row to determine whether it should be shown or hidden.

* Add "Include" and "Exclude" text boxes for filter texts.

* For each row, check {"Log source", "Source Location", "Log Message"}

cells separately for matches.

* Underlying selection logic: under .

* Matching: Case-sensitive substring search.

* Hide a row if the following hold:

* If "exclude" text is non-empty, any match.

* If "include" text is non-empty, no match.

* Filtering is triggered by "include" / "exclude" input changes (thus

avoiding the need for a "Filter" button).

* To reduce churn, each input change triggers a 500ms timer, after

which global filtering is applied. Timers are coalesced.

* Filters are applied to new rows as they appear.

* Render "shown rows / total rows" stats.



Bug: 329133014

entry.title: capture_mode: Make sure camera preview and game toolbar do not overlap
entry.content:
It is currently possible to have the game dashboard toolbar intersect

the recording camera preview. With this change, the camera preview will

take the toolbar's position into consideration and move out of the way.



The toolbar is currently drawn above the camera preview, so therefore we

let the toolbar have priority. That is, if the toolbar is moved to cover

the camera preview, the preview moves out of the way. If the user tries

to move the camera preview to cover the toolbar, the preview will find

another place to exist.



BUG=b:297128879

entry.title: documentScan: Extend d-bus timeout for slow operations
entry.content:
lorgnette tries to keep its d-bus responses quick by using non-blocking

I/O and polling wherever possible. However, for some combinations of

backends and scanners, the underlying SANE libraries don't respond until

the hardware makes a certain amount of progress (e.g. waiting for the

ADF to pick up a subsequent sheet in a multi-page scan). Since these

operations can take 30s or more to finish, the d-bus response is also

delayed.



For the cases where these delays have been observed, we can extend

Chrome's timeout. This shouldn't affect the common case because

lorgnette normally responds well before the timeout, but it avoids

having flaky failures in the middle of scans on slow devices.



Bug: b/274861301

Test: documentScan test extension with several slow scanners

Change-Id: I2e6ab2e74da36f6fcb733c4d8dee71fdac5b0b6f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5367170

Reviewed-by: Nathan Muggli

Commit-Queue: Benjamin Gordon

the number of IActivityManager binder transactions in the UIThread.

entry.title: Shared Storage: Change DevTools token to global id in event reporting
entry.content:
We are currently passing the main frame's DevTools frame token to the

DevTools `content::StorageHandler` when reporting shared storage

events. We shouldn't be using this token outside of DevTools, however.



Instead, here we change to passing a `GlobalRenderFrameHostId` to the

`content::StorageHandler`. Then, in the `StorageHandler`, we can

translate the `GlobalRenderFrameHostId` into a DevTools frame token.

entry.title: [remoting corp logging] Implement CorpHostStatusLogger
entry.content:
This CL implements the CorpHostStatusLogger and hooks it up with the

JingleSessionManager, so that it reports the disconnect event to the

corp logging service with both the error code and the SessionAuthz

reauth token attached.



The tricky part of this CL is to pass the reauth token from the

SessionAuthzReauthorizer to the CorpHostStatusLogger. There is

`HostStatusObserver`, but it implements a mojo interface, meaning it

will be rather difficult to pass pointers around (without being rejected

by the mojo reviewer). Just passing the reauth token around in callbacks

would also work, but that would be very messy.



To get that working, this CL introduces a `SessionObserver`, which

allows implementations to observer state changes on multiple sessions

and know which session has changed. `authentication_type()` and

`implementing_authenticator()` are added to `Authenticator` to allow

`CorpHostStatusLogger` to extract the reauth token from the generalized

`Authenticator` reference.



Bug: b/328138087

entry.title: media/gpu: H.264 add safe math checks for expected pic order count
entry.content:
Previous to this CL, the H.264 decoder would not check an SPS slice's

|expected_delta_per_pic_order_cnt_cycle| parameter. If this is not

initialized properly and negative, it can lead to integer overflow

errors when attempting to calculate pic order counts.



Updates H.264 decoder to check that the expected pic order count

calculation is valid and won't cause an integer overflow.



Also ran the fuzzer test attached to the bug successfully.

entry.title: Revert "Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 49599d86419c742d12d118e12bf30b79f64c69b0.



Reason for revert: cause tree closure https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac-arm64-on-arm64-rel/101537/overview



Original change's description:

> Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts

>

> While moving ByteSwap() callers, I found the DTS code doing byte swaps

> by casting byte spans to uint16_t spans, which causes UB if they are

> not aligned. The function explicitly handles non-16-bit aligned inputs

> earlier, so clearly it's expected and we should not CHECK on the

> alignment. So instead, change the code to work with bytes and do the

> swaps in a for loop.

>

> While here, make use of the new split_at() to split the output span

> up into disjoint subspans that are each written to.

>

> R=dalecurtis@chromium.org

entry.title: [freezing] Remove PageLiveStateDecorator::Delegate.
entry.content:
As part of the effort to freeze "browsing instances" instead of

"pages", we need to move all freezing logic to

//components/performance_manager (see crrev.com/c/5318016).

However, moving //c/b/pm/policies/freezing_policy_unittest.cc to

//components/performance_manager would create a circular dependency:



c/b/pm/policies/freezing_policy_unittest.cc

c/b/pm/decorators/page_live_state_decorator_delegate_impl.h

components/permissions

components/content_settings/browser

components/page_load_metrics/browser

components/performance_manager



To prevent that circular dependency, this CL simply removes

PageLiveStateDecorator::Delegate and moves tracking of the

notification permission to PerformanceManagerTabHelper. This

has benefits in addition to allowing the move of all freezing logic

to //components/performance/manager:



- Reduces complexity (less lines of code)

- Eliminates a thread hop on main frame navigation

- Makes the logic more accurate (previously, PerformanceManager only

considered the value of ContentSettingsType::NOTIFICATIONS but

that's not the only factor involved in granting the notification

permission).



Bug: 325954772

Change-Id: I422a23c2567bf5e69343db9fca3928bedec80e4e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5324402

entry.content:
This is needed for out of process video decoding for protected content

where decryption needs to be invoked from the same process that is doing

decoding. This is part of the V4L2 ARM design where the V4L2Decoder

provide the secure buffers to the pipeline's decryptor.

entry.title: Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts
entry.content:
While moving ByteSwap() callers, I found the DTS code doing byte swaps

by casting byte spans to uint16_t spans, which causes UB if they are

not aligned. The function explicitly handles non-16-bit aligned inputs

earlier, so clearly it's expected and we should not CHECK on the

alignment. So instead, change the code to work with bytes and do the

swaps in a for loop.



While here, make use of the new split_at() to split the output span

up into disjoint subspans that are each written to.



R=dalecurtis@chromium.org

entry.title: [DefaultPrompt] Implement new reprompt logic
entry.content:
When the DefaultBrowserPromptRefresh feature is enabled, reprompt the

user based on the last declined time/declined count. The duration

between declining the prompt and another one being shown will follow

an exponential backoff determined by the feature params.



This CL also moves the migration function for the last declined time

pref to MigrateObsoleteLocalStatePrefs in browser_prefs.cc. Previously

it was being called in ShouldShowDefaultBrowserPrompt because

local_state() could be a nullptr if it was called from

MigrateObsoleteLocalStatePrefs. Since I found that this would only

happen in tests, after adding a check to short circuit if local state is

null, we can safely move the function to it's intended call site.





Fixed: 326078968

entry.title: Fix how inclusive language exemptions are generated.
entry.content:
Before this CL

`infra/update_inclusive_language_presubmit_exempt_dirs.sh` would be run

before `git add -f third_party/rust` which meant that it missed

exemptions needed by the new crate versions. This CL fixes this by

reordering when such `git add ...` happens.



This CL also makes the following additional improvements that were

identified as desirable during this week's crate updating rotation:



* `tools/rust/update_rust.py` is run at the start of the script.

This takes care of one prerequisite for running the script in a

`git-new-workdir` environment. And in general, ensuring that

`third_party/rust-toolchain` version matches the current branch

seems desirable.



* The title of the CL description has been refactored to 1) mention

the crate name early (for easier readability in environments that only

show the first X characters of a title) and 2) to mention both the old

and the new versions of the main crate being updated (still not

mentioning transitively updated crates in the title, but they are

already mentioned in the main body of the CL description)



* The `cargo vet` criteria are discovered 1) *after* `gnrt vendor` (an

update shouldn't change the criteria required for the main crate but

criteria of transitive dependencies may be affected by an update) and

2) the CL description covers per-crate criteria (to provide complete

information, which may be important in cases where transitive

dependencies have different criteria from the main crate being

updated).



* There are also some opportunistic refactorings of the script

(e.g. adding type annotations).



Bug: 40221377

Change-Id: I59e77b753617ce72882a789aab9be3ff2811292a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5367004
